interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Shepherd
Review Date: 2019/04/05
Categories: Drama, Faith and Spirituality, Easygoing, Tense
Product Description: ['Exciting "top gun" action and conflict in the lives of the men who push the edge of danger defending our skies.']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Donald W. Thompson'], 'Producers': ['Donald W. Thompson', 'Peg Courter', 'Russell S. Doughten Jr.'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Stone', 'Dee Wallace', 'Pepper Martin']}
Review Text: The box art cover is a instant classic. A pilot in full flight suit holding a lamb.  Supersonic good clean fun with jets & explosion & stuff. Instant tear jerker. And lambs.
Review Title: nothing to do with interspecies sex
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:

Everybody justs sleepwalks thru this entire flick. And for Vin before I even cash my check on a mish mash script effectively kills any chance for another sequel for this franchise not that it matters. This franchise deserved a better send off than this. Makes watching paint dry exciting again. And we have cgi over kill and cinema verde' waste of talent. massive pile of turds doing a double ollie & back flip {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Français (Canada)', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Français (France)'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Español (Latinoamérica) [CC]', 'Español (España) [CC]', 'Suomi', 'Français [CC]', 'Italiano [CC]', 'Nederlands [CC]', 'Nynorsk', 'Polski', 'Português [SDH]', 'Svenska'], 'Directors': ['Jon Turteltaub'], 'Producers': ['Gerald R. Molen', 'Wayne Wei Jiang', 'Randy Greenberg', 'Catherine Xujun Ying', 'Chantal Nong', 'Barrie M. Osborne', 'Belle Avery', 'Colin Wilson', 'Lorenzo Di Bonaventura'], 'Starring': ['Jason Statham', 'Rainn Wilson', 'Ruby Rose'], 'Studio': ['WARNER HOME VIDEO']} sh*t tiered cgi effects, along with lazy throw everything at the wall script leaves the cast almost sleep walking thru this aquamarine turd fest. From uninspired acting, editing and camera work - not even biggest shark ever to grace the screen can make this made for big screen in & out over the weekend 153 plus minute waste of humanity float.
Do yourself a favor & watch paint dry for better entertainment value. absolute turd pile {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Vizcarra'], 'Producers': ['Victor Vizcarra', 'Michael Vizcarra'], 'Starring': ['Larry Poole', 'Victor Vizcarra', 'Murphy Neal Jones']} There was no chance of winning in SE Asia period. From even Pentagons own study , known as Pentagon Papers which examined the US role from 1945 -1967' in the area the real reason for the US involvement in Vietnam was to contain China expanision . One of three fronts long-run effort to contain China (realizing that the USSR "contains" China on the north and northwest):
(a) the Japan–Korea front;
(b) the India–Pakistan front; and
(c) the Southeast Asia front.
The fantasy put forth by political bias in this film is the same insanity that brought the US to bomb Laos, Cambodia & expand the war into US politics that made Watergate topple the Nixon administration in it's pursiut for fatally flawed foriegn & domestic policy. Thud Pilots in a massive steamy Dud movie {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Neil Hollander', 'Rick Gordon', 'Mark H Tuttle'], 'Producers': ['Peter Maris', 'Donna K Tuttle', 'Mark H Tuttle'], 'Starring': ['Neil Armstrong']} First off Neil Armstrong is a god. Awesome narration. But this aviation series suffers major flaws , mistakes in so many areas it would take pages just to list. So for example lets look at episode 13 that centers on jets. The myth that german aviation specifically the TA -183 heavily influenced the Mig-15 . MiG-15 is merely a progression of the MiG-9 using information that was generally understood after the WWII. The MiG-9 was developed before any of the Ta-183 data was avalible and Ta-183's key feature was the high T-tail which was also its greatest short coming. The design history of the MiG-15 is available from the Mikoyan OKB Archives. English-language secondary sources include Mikoyan OKB by Bill Gunston, Soviet Secret Projects (Fighters) by Tony Buttler and MiG-15 by Yefim Gordon. All the authors are internationally respected and authoritative sources and all have concluded that the Ta-183 and MiG-15 are not related. Incidently in Tony Buttler's book he reveals that one rejected layout for the MiG-15 had forward-swept wings. another aviation series with some major flaws {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Various'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Lee', 'Peter Read'], 'Studio': ['HDP']} The 2nd Film is a horror gem from1964 - Dementia 13' and is Francis Ford Coppola's first flick, his directorial debut. Yeah, that's right. The man that brought you Apocalypse Now and The Godfather worked first in horror. Under rated horror gems The Shepherd Drama, Faith and Spirituality, Easygoing, Tense ['Exciting "top gun" action and conflict in the lives of the men who push the edge of danger defending our skies.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Donald W. Thompson'], 'Producers': ['Donald W. Thompson', 'Peg Courter', 'Russell S. Doughten Jr.'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Stone', 'Dee Wallace', 'Pepper Martin']} The box art cover is a instant classic. A pilot in full flight suit holding a lamb. Supersonic good clean fun with jets & explosion & stuff. Instant tear jerker. And lambs. nothing to do with interspecies sex
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Overall Sentiment:** The user retains a strongly negative stance towards poorly executed films, marked by disappointment in franchise oversight and low-quality storytelling. They are discerning regarding historical accuracy in documentary-style content but have recently shown an ability to enjoy films outside their usual critique, especially within the drama genre. 

- **Rating Pattern:** Traditionally assigning low scores to poorly crafted films, the user has displayed heightened generosity towards films featuring compelling narratives, recently rating a drama with unexpected enjoyment. This indicates a growing appreciation for diverse storytelling beyond their established preference for horror.

- **Content Preferences:** The user values high-quality storytelling and character development, remains critical of clichés, and is attentive to details such as production values and content advisories. Their recent interaction shows an openness to films exploring faith and spirituality, provided they maintain engaging narratives.

- **Themes:** They continue to disapprove of uninspired performances and predictable scripts but balance this with recognition of hidden gems that excel in quality regardless of genre. They express their views with a sarcastic humor, reflecting their complex relationship with film.

- **Community Engagement:** The user maintains an active role in critiquing media, advocating for nuanced storytelling, and recognizing exceptions that defy low expectations while also grappling with franchise disappointments and inaccuracies in related content. 

This updated profile reflects the user's nuanced approach to media and evolving appreciation for quality in diverse formats.
